problem_text: Suppose B is a subgroup of the symmetric group SΩ on an infinite set Ω. Will the amalgamated free product SΩ ∗B SΩ of two copies of SΩ with amalgamation of B be embeddable in SΩ? This is a weakened form of the group case of Question 4.4 in (G. M. Bergman, Indag. Math., 18 (2007), 349–403). It is known that SΩ ∗B SΩ need not be so embeddable by a map respecting B (Algebra Number Theory, 3 (2009), 847–879, § 10). G. M. Bergman
